CatDescriptText: Miss Mary Louise Linzino, business school student, 104 Lexington Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that American citizens should receive Russia's first deputy premier, Anastas I. Mikoyan hospitably, or deport themselves in unhospitable fashion like some have done in several cities where Mikoyan has visited?" answer reads: �We should receive him as our guest. Perhaps in that way we will get to know more about him and his country.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Louise Linzino, wearing light colored patterned head scarf, dark coat with light colored buttons, and dark leather gloves, holding paper bag and handbag in left arm, standing on Smithfield Street with C.A. Michel sign in background, Downtown
